page.title: 06HOUSING IN CODICOTE/WELWYN
page.content: The absence of industrial development and the easy access to railway and motorways has ensured that Codicote / Welwyn is a popular residential area. House prices are high - ranging from Â£40,000 for a terraced cottage to Â£175,000 for houses outside the villages. There are over 2000 dwellings including 10 farms and 140 houses in rural positions. Codicote village has 836 houses, flats and bungalows including 300 owned by North Hertfordshire District Council. Welwyn has 912 dwellings of which 125 belong to Welwyn/Hatfield District Council. Both village centres have modernised terraced Victorian cottages and villas beyond which are major post 1945 estates containing larger family houses. Purpose built accommodation is available for the elderly.
